inn1.comm: big roar as Mashrafe runs in, delivers a decent ball - fullish outside off, no swing as yet and Strauss lets it go by
England are away, Mashrafe drifting into the pads and Strauss clips it confidently to deep square
nervy start from the batsman, it's a fullish length on and around off stump, Kieswetter gets half forward and defends with an inside edge

Mashrafe strikes! Kieswetter falls again, Kieswetter bowled again! Massive start for Bangladesh! It was full and nipping back, Kieswetter as usual staying leg side of the ball an it got an inside edge and flew through a gaping space between bat and pad on to the stumps!
ooh, good first ball at him, Trott defended by playing across the ball a fraction, it pitched and left him and skewed off a leading edge
Mashrafe ends an excellent over, Trott is forward and defending a touch uneasily. Great lengths from Mashrafe - full - it's the example the other quicks have to follow
tidy start from him, fullish and on a decent line, Strauss clips it firmly but straight to square leg
Strauss has got a good calm air about him and he guides this rising ball down to third man for a single
there's a great atmosphere out there, Shafiul getting a big cheer as he runs up, delivers this on a good line outside off and Trott blocks
top shot this, it was a touch short, not very, but Trott was back and flicked it off his hip powerfully, timing it ideally and collecting four to deep midwicket
too short again from Shafiul and Trott rides the bounce and punches it off the back foot through extra cover for two more
four more! Trott is away! Too short, a touch too far down the leg side and Trott whips it through square leg for four
ooooh! Very close here, Mashrafe going much fuller than Shafiul, Strauss aims a defensive block and it finds a genuine outside edge but lands short of first slip
shot! That is not the place to bowl, not to Strauss, not a green top. It was very short and Strauss rocked back and slapped it over midwicket for six
that's better from Mashrafe, much better, fuller and it jags away off the pitch
Mashrafe is lucky to get away with this, he committed to cardinal sin to Strauss - short and wide - but the cut shot found point
good work from the England captain, gets this off his hip and works it down to fine leg for a swiftly-taken couple
good ball to finish meets a full-faced block from Strauss. Very solid
good start from the new bowler, crucially a full length, and straight and Trott hurries into a defence
good ball again, rising from a length outside off, Trott blocks solidly
very full again, Rubel has started well, Trott taps it to mid off and takes a single
slung across Strauss from over the wicket, full, maybe later in his innings Strauss would have had a dart at it, but at the moment he's content to leave
good ball this, closer to off stump, rising from a decent length, Strauss shoulders arms
one bad ball ruins the over, and it deserved all it got, short, wide, four. Strauss needs no second invitation in that area
the runs keep flowing, touch too short and a fraction of width allows Trott to stroke it to deep point for a single
much better from Mashrafe, that's all Bangladesh need to do, fullish and on a good line, bit of nibble off the surface and blocked
Strauss looks in good order, defending with the straightest of blades
a fraction short, which is pretty criminal on this surface, allows Strauss to drive off the back foot where a sprawling save at point keeps it to one
that's why these Bangladesh seamers need to hold their nerve here, decent length and it nips back a long way off the surface into Trott's pads
the final ball again comes back a long way at Trott, and he can't connect with an attempted leg-side nurdle
Rubel liked this! He followed through a long way to have a stare at Strauss, it was full and zipped past Strauss's attempted drive
good ball again, forcing Strauss into a defensive block
that's the place to bowl, especially to Strauss, full, on and around off, and Strauss leaves
once again Rubel continues to probe the channel outside off stump, he just needs to stay there for the entire over
having left the last few Strauss this time plays, calmly guiding it down to third man for a couple
good over in the end, finishes with another leave outside off stump
good start to Mashrafe's new over, fullish and around off stump, Trott defends
nicely bowled, touch of extra bounce from a length outside off stump, Trott defends uneasily
good shot deserved four, but it's a slow and damp outfield, pitched up, which is good from Mashrafe, Trott drives nicely towards deep cover
Mashrafe continues he good work and Trott can only defend
very good delivery this, drawing Trott forward, it moves away a fraction off the pitch and runs off the outer-half of the bat towards point
tidy finish to the over from Mashrafe, but there is not quite the devil in the pitch that a bright green surface would suggest
lovely stuff from Rubel, slinging it full and straight, finding some in-drift, Trott jabs it out to mid on
pulls his length back a fraction, but not too short, Trott works it to fine leg for a single
neatly played by Strauss, he's looked serene this morning, and gently strokes this to mid off
slung in on a good line and length, Trott hops back and defends
oh dear, no ball this time, the delivery itself was not appalling, outside off and defended but it's free hit time!
the free hit will have to be bowled again, because it's short and bounces miles over Trott

this time it's a touch fuller, Trott has a mow, and it comes off the top edge, sails over the keeper and one-bounces for four. Poor discipline from Bangladesh, I'd hate to think what Siddons is making of it. He looks very glum in the dressing room
good response from Rubel, swift pace, touch of bounce and Trott takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
good from Mashrafe, heading towards the top of off and Strauss blocks
good length here, drawing Strauss forward and into a calm defence
Mashrafe needs to maintain this approach, full and around off stump, Strauss can only defend
this time Strauss tries to whip it into the leg side but finds midwicket
Strauss rocks forward into a defensive block - "very good, very good, looking good" is the call from the Bangladesh fielders, and I agree
thuds off the thigh pad this time, just moving back into Strauss a touch, and runs away for a single to square leg
slung wide of Strauss outside off, he thought about a cut but opted to leave well alone
good cricket this, very full and around off stump, and Strauss drives very firmly to mid off
good stuff again from Rubel and Strauss defends firmly to point
good shot, this time it was a touch overpitched, but that's far less a crime than bowling short, Strauss climbed into a square drive and it sped away for four
good response from Rubel, back on to a good length and line and Strauss blocks
good over finishes with Strauss defending
Mashrafe strikes a good length, fullish and just on off stump, curving away through the air. Defended to cover
this was full again, but slightly wider and so Trott raises his bat out of the way to leave
probing stuff, this! Mashrafe lands it on a length on off stump again and the ball jags away off the seam after pitching. Trott's watching it really closely though, and hops back to defend to off
Mashrafe's trying to set him up here, as he sends one down straighter and moves it the other way off the seam, into the pads, but again it's defended solidly
full and shaping away outside off, left alone
on a length, jammed hard down into the wicket, the ball bounces up and over Mashrafe but lands on the base of the stumps at the non-striker's end
in the channel on or around off stump, Strauss presses forward to defend
too straight, Strauss shuffles slightly to off and works the ball away behind square on the leg side with ease
again too straight, and Strauss really punishes him this time. Leg-stump half-volley and Strauss glances past short fine leg to pick up a boundary.
Shafiul comes round the wicket, and is dismissively pulled over midwicket! Too short, especially on this wicket, and Strauss pounces. Poor bowling
that's better, fuller on off stump. But all the pressure's off now, Strauss just defends
Shafiul's losing it here, not the comeback over he was hoping for. Short and wide outside off, Strauss scythes a cut past backward point. Crunched right out of the middle
well, Mashrafe is keeping it tight at least. Full, just outside off and Trott leaves alone.
just short of a length, outside off but Trott hops back and whips across the line to pick up a single to straight midwicket. The line was ok, but Trott was able to nudge it away on length
Strauss is just having a look too, cautiously seeing Mashrafe off. Full, angling across and Strauss leaves
on middle and off this time, Strauss leans forward and drives back down the wicket, but the bowler collects in his follow-through
tight lines, cramping Strauss for room as he defends down towards cover point
Strauss looks for the single on the leg side as he flicks across the line to a ball outside off stump, but picks out the close fielder
decent start, full and straight and Trott nudges defensively to leg
on off stump this time, Trott steps back and pushes to point
full and on the toes, Trott leans forward and tucks across to midwicket
full, quick through the air and defended
straighter this time, driven to mid-on
tight single! Trott flicks to mid-on and they set off straight away, the fielder has a shy and hits the stumps but Trott dives and is safely home. Not out, says the TV umpire
and he's still keeping it tight. Back of a length, Trott hops onto his toes and tries to nudge to leg. Can't quite get it away

edged! Great bowling, he gets one to spit up off a length and jag away to take a thick edge. The ball drops just short and slightly wide of the solitary man at slip. It wasn't a chance, but that was mighty close! Well played by Trott too, soft hands
on a length, zeroing in on off stump and Strauss defends
too short, Mashrafe doesn't have the pace to bowl like that anymore. Strauss slams a pull out to deep square leg, but there's a fielder out on the boundary to cut it off
taken from outside off and whipped across the line, but straight to the midwicket fielder. He's played that shot a lot today
uppish! Again he takes a ball from outside off and tries to open up the leg side. This time he didn't quite get on top of the bounce and the ball arrived at the fielder on the bounce
beaten on the cut! Strauss stays deep in the crease and tries to slash it away, but that was too full to be cut and the ball nips under the bat
a couple of steps down the track this time, and nudged away to midwicket for a single
reverse-sweep! Great execution of the shot by Trott, the ball was full and just outside off. He set himself early, kept his eye on the ball and just angled it down to third man for four
keeps low! Things are happening now, Razzak gets one to nip on straight and the lack of bounce almost does for Trott. Gets the bat down just in time
skipping down the track this time, but Razzak sees him coming and spears it in shorter to strike him on the pad
another reverse sweep, but this one doesn't quite come off and the ball rolls to point
very round-arm from round the wicket, punched back down the wicket
wrong line from Shakib, he sends it down towards leg stump from a very wide angle and Trott has no trouble getting down on one knee to sweep the ball hard down to fine leg
that's better, aiming at middle and off and Trott defends
some turn and bounce for Shakib! But although it's appreciable, it's still playable. Trott defends
punched defensively to off
full and tapped back to the bowler to finish
he comes round the wicket to the left-hander, and is on the spot to start. Full and off stump, Strauss defends
just a hint of width, and Strauss hangs back to slap a cut to backward point. But he picks out the fielder
arm ball from Mahmudullah, but it's hurled towards leg stump and Strauss sweeps powerfully to deep backward square
Trott just stands at the crease, waits for the ball to get to him and pushes firmly to long-on with a straight bat. Risk-free single
immediately the paddle-sweep comes out, and he's got it quite fine so that's two runs
leg-stump line again, Strauss tries to flick to leg. He gets some boot on the ball, and they take a leg-bye
drifting away through the air and turning in slightly from over the wicket, Strauss defends back down the wicket
reverse-sweep from Strauss now! He was into position before the ball had even been bowled, and gets a good connection to beat the man at backward point
charging down the track now, and nudging to square leg for a single
full on middle and off, Trott drives to long-off
tapped to long-on, easy one
Shakib drifts in to the pads, and Trott works the ball infront of square leg to keep the strike
Trott hangs back, the ball turns in to him and is drilled to long-on
swept well, but straight to the man on the boundary at long leg
Mahmudullah comes round the wicket to Trott, who nudges into the leg side
whipped past square leg, and out to the man in the deep
flicked out to deep square leg, and that'll be fifty for Strauss. Nothing to extravagant in the celebrations, he looks to be bedding in for a long innings
very full and on the toes, Trott glances out to deep midwicket. Good timing, and the fielder on the boundary has to sprint to cut that off
Strauss is showing how down with the kidz he is, this time it's a reverse-sweep, playing it nicely, meeting it on the full and flapping it round the to fine third man for four
this time he skips down the wicket and works it to deep square for one, good batting
Trott is carefully forward and defending
Trott this time works a single, these two looking settled now
Strauss forward and patting back to the bowler
hundred partnership up, Strauss working it into space and these two have laid a good platform now
Mahmudullah continues, floating up to Strauss who tickles it in front of square on the leg side for a single
touch of drift there, but Trott was in a good position to sweep and played it firmly to deep square
Strauss leans this in front of midwicket for a single, pretty easy runs available with the field set back
Trott works this firmly back down the wicket, but Mahmudullah dives to field off his own bowling
another easy milk for Trott this time, picking it off to deep square
Strauss skips down the wicket and pushes it crisply to long off for another single
touch short to begin with but the line is good and Strauss works off his hip to square leg
this is floated up full and wide outside off stump, Trott was a touch slow to get into position to drive and ended up skewing an inside edge into the leg side
Shafiul dishes up another invitation to drive and this time Trott makes no mistake, driving very sweetly through extra cover for four
follows the boundary with an open-faced work to third man for single
back of a length here but a good line and Strauss defends
good ball here, just a touch of nibble away off the pitch, Strauss aimed to defend and it zipped past the edge. There was an appeal from behind the stumps but nothing from the bowler
and starts well, sliding it on a length and line and Trott defends
this is shoved a touch down the leg side, Trott happy to knock it to deep square for a single

well, this looks very odd. Strauss went early to reverse sweep, Razzak fired it down the leg side, so Strauss ended up trying to play a reverse-guide-to-third-man, he missed, and it was called wide. Oh wait! No, after much hand signals and chatter, it's still a wide.
after all that commotion, Trott gets forward and defends
this time he aims a drive, but it's a decent ball from Razzak and Trott can't time the shot
this is sliding down the leg side a fraction, Trott picks it off for a single
anyway, Strauss clips this to deep square for a single
Trott in the meantime has played this drive very firmly to deep point to bring up his second successive 50
Strauss is beaten outside off stump this time, it was full outside off from Shafiul, which is definitely the place to bowl to Strauss, and it ghosted past the edge
full and straight again and Strauss connects with a drive, firmly to mid off
this time Strauss defends with very soft hands, dropping it towards point and scooting off for one
better over from Shafiul and it ends with Trott defending in a hurry off the back foot
Strauss dances down the wicket, but Razzak held it back a fraction, so Strauss had to wait and then play a very delicate push towards mid off and take a single
top shot this, very good from Trott, picked a gap in front of midwicket and shoved the ball through from outside off stump, timing it well for four
follows up the boundary with a single, pushing it towards point
Strauss gets down on one knee, looking in a strong position to sweep early, and playing the shot very firmly down to deep square
Trott happily drives it down the ground for a single
milked well again, clipped in front of square on the leg side to end Razzak's comeback over
this one's for Simon! Six! Too short from Shafiul, why I don't know, Strauss eagerly slaps a pull shot, with a hint of top edge, over the rope at deep square
and now he can push to mid off and scamper through for a single
Trott is on the front foot and driving firmly, but straight to cover
touch too wide and Trott happily guides it to third man
bowl full and there are so fewer options for Strauss, he pushes confidently to cover
back of a length again, Strauss works it towards straight midwicket and steals the strike
good from Strauss, skipping down the wicket and driving firmly to long on, where a sprawling stop keeps it to one
Trott has timed the ball very well today, stroking neatly through the covers for a couple
this time he's forward and defending
touch short from Razzak, Trott is back and bunting it firmly to long on
Strauss this time collects one, milking to deep midwicket
oh lovely shot, really good from Trott, he timed this superbly, it was a touch short and he whipped it at the top of the bounce, well in front of midwicket for four
they wont get it from this, dragged very short and Strauss flaps it to deep midwicket
better from Shakib and Trott defends crisply
this time Trott drives carefully to long off for  single
good shot, pulling a spinner is always tricky, especially Shakib who really skids them through, Strauss was back in an instant and crashed it in front of midwicket for a boundary
now he guides it to short third man and scampers through for a swift single
Trott goes down on one knee very early and dinks a paddle-sweep round the corner for a single
Razzak continues, and is worked firmly to square leg
single here for Trott, pushed past a diving midwicket for one
Strauss milks another, clipping it round the corner
too short from Razzak, allows Trott to rock back and stroke a cut shot away that finds deep extra cover
Strauss skips down the wicket early, Razzak responds by darting it in quicker, in the end it's flicked to deep midwicket for one
Trott keeps the strike by shoving it down the ground
tapped to cover, big gaps seemingly everywhere in the field now and another easy single
pushed across Strauss from round the wicket, chopped to backward point
a touch too short on off stump, Trott sends the ball out to deep cover off the back foot

forward defence from Strauss... but he's played it as a right-hander, and very awkwardly at that! He went down to switch-hit, setting himself very early but when the ball wasn't there to be hit he opted for some ungainly defence...
flicked out on the leg side
full, right on the pads and Trott nudges past square leg

such good timing from Trott on that whip through midwicket. He plays that shot, barely seems to hit it, but he's picked up a couple of boundaries down there and this was almost another one. Good, diving stop saves runs on the boundary
driven hard, but straight to cover
huge! Strauss comes down the track and clubs this miles over long-on. Absolutely hammered, and that has landed in the building site at that end of the ground!
floated up invitingly just outside off, Strauss stays deep in the crease though and pushes cautiously to cover
Strauss skips down the track again, this time the bowler spots him coming and fires it wide. But Strauss is seeing it so well, he simply re-adjusts and cuts past point instead
speared down the leg side, Trott shapes to flick through midwicket. The ball clips the pad on the way through to the 'keeper and there's an appeal, but quickly put down
on Strauss's toes, and he clips to square leg
some turn for Shakib, and Trott is slightly squared up but taps it back down the wicket easily enough
going on with the arm this time, defended
edged! Genuine edge off Trott's bat, through the vacant slip area and down to third man
pushed defensively to leg

chopped towards point, Trott looks for a single and is sent back - just in time too. He dives for the crease, the ball pops out of the 'keeper's glove as he breaks the stumps though, so wouldn't have been out anyway
leg-stump half-volley nudged to deep square for one
back of a length, Trott aims a slightly uncertain push through the off side and is well beaten
again beaten on the outside edge! Trott comes down to have a word with Strauss and a look at the pitch. There may have been a touch of extra bounce on that one
flung down very wide, Trott would've got a wide if he hadn't slapped that out to cover point
very full on off stump, not quite the yorker but close to it. Strauss drives back to the bowler, but off the toe end of the bat
shot! Strauss goes to 98 with a textbook cover drive. Pitched up outside off, not quite the half-volley but Strauss drives on the up and pierces the cover field, great balance and timing in the drive
landing gently on a length just outside off, not much work on the ball and Trott pushes firmly down to long-on
clipped from outside off to the man at midwicket
again Strauss picks the ball up from outside off stump and nudges to leg, this time beating the fielder to move to 99
tapped to extra cover, Trott thinks about the single but is quickly sent back
driven to cover off the front foot this time, piercing the gap to get Strauss back on strike

and that'll be the hundred! Now he celebrates. He was muted when he got to fifty, but now off comes the helmet and he raises his bat to the crowd. Superb innings from Strauss, he's scored freely all round the wicket, and gets to the ton with a little tickle round the corner to short fine leg
well, the line was ok but the length was far too short. That's just too easy for Strauss, who rocks onto the back foot and crunches a pull out to deep square leg
again back of a length and straight, this time Strauss is content to just work it off his hip to short fine leg for one
fuller from Rubel, Trott dinks to cover and they pick up a quick single
short and wide outside the off stump this time, terrible bowling from Rubel. He's hitting a length to Trott, but as soon as Strauss comes on strike it's just a load of short, wide filth
slower ball, looked like a cutter and Strauss was slightly caught out by it but went through with the cover drive to chip the ball over the cover.
yorker to finish, outside off stump and jammed out back to the bowler
the runs are flowing now! Half-volley on leg stump, Trott gets down on one knee and sweeps hard down to long leg.

four more! And the runs aren't coming from slogs, just well-executed cricket shots. This time Trott hangs back and clips through midwicket, the shot he's played so many times today and he's playing it well
fuller this time, and Trott defends
placement! Trott goes into the 90s with a drive through gully. The ball was full and wide, and as he hit the ball he opened the face of the blade to pick the gap
square driven again, this time on the other side of the backward point fielder
Bangladesh are unravelling now. Trott clips to midwicket, quick single is ttaken and a wild throw lets them through for another as the ball goes to long-off
slipping in to the pads first ball, and Strauss nudges out to deep square leg
full and straight, Trott clips elegantly out to deep midwicket, the fielder charges round but that's an easy two and Trott goes to 99

there's the hundred! Trott is well-pleased with that, off comes the helmet as he carves a square drive through point. He missed out on what would've been a matchwinning ton in the last game, but he's cashed in today
slipping down the leg side, the ball clips the pad on the way through to Jahurul
full and straight, whipped out to deep square leg

imperious! Strauss backs away to leg, picking a slower ball from Shafiul and slamming a drive through cover. Again, it wasn't a slog, he just picked his spot and hit the ball hard, but it was an orthodox stroke. Great batting, but it must be said Bangladesh aren't exactly making it hard for him
low, dipping full toss, and it's driven down to long-on
Strauss dances down the track to glance an inswinging length delivery down to fine leg
another full toss, on leg stump this time and it's flicked to long leg
nurdled to straight midwicket, the fielder charges round to cut off the single
slower ball, offcutter and it's worked away to deep square leg.

good yorker from Mashrafe gets Strauss in a bit of a tangle as he tries to shovel through midwicket. The ball takes the edge and flies towards gully. Appeal from the bowler, presumably for lbw, but that's right off the bat
bottom-handed swipe to deep midwicket, between the fielders and they sprint back for the second
Strauss takes a couple of steps down the track to take the ball on the full and send it down to long-on
driven well by Trott, but picks out the cover fielder so just one
slammed towards mid-off, Shakib does really well in sprinting across to cut it off
full toss, outside off, and Strauss backs to leg to smash through cover. Picks the fielder though
brilliant shot! Lofted cover drive just sails over the boundary. Great timing, didn't over-hit it, just balance and timing
so, two overs of Powerplay left and starts with a single
Strauss wanders well outside leg stump, but Mashrafe follows him with a full ball that Strauss digs out
Strauss goes off side this time and Mashrafe spears it down the leg side
lovely shot here, very correct, skipping down the wicket and crisply punching a lofted drive over mid off with the straightest of bats
Strauss is again walking well outside leg stump, Mashrafe follows him again but it's too far down leg, the keeper fumbles as he collects allowing an extra run to be scampered

good catch! Trott falls but it's been a fantastic knock, England were nervy when he came to the crease at 1 for 1, but he leaves them in utter control. It was full and Trott mowed it towards straightish midwicket where Shakib moved sharply to his right and held on to a tough chance

oh dear! Bad luck for Wright he's sacrificed himself. Skipped outside leg stump and he had a fearful slash at it, only managed to feather a top edge through to the keeper. Unlucky for him and Mashrafe suddenly has two in two!
ooh close! Almost a hat-trick for Mashrafe! Good full length, found a leading edge from Collingwood that chipped uppishly towards mid off
darts it into Strauss from over the wicket, good bowling with that field, and Strauss bunts it down the ground
Collingwood nurdles his first ball wide of long on with soft hands to collect a couple
this time he's very studiously forward and defending
good bowling from Shakib, darting it in and Collingwood skips down the wicket and clips a single to midwicket
shot! Full toss from Shakib, Strauss down the ground and swinging this into the scoreboard. Really nailed it
missed stumping, Strauss was well down the wicket looking for an inside-out drive over cover, the ball came back between bat and pad but the keeper spilled the take

Collingwood down on one knee looking to dink it round the corner, comes off the pads and Strauss sets off for one which wasn't there, the keeper fielded but missed the stumps with his throw, Strauss would have been well short
this time Strauss is trying to swing it into the leg side but can't connect
reverse-sweep attempted here, and Strauss timed it very well but picked out short third man
four this time! Conventional sweep and he picked the gap between deep square and deep midwicket, connected very firmly
well he must be seeing them well, Strauss shaped up to reverse-sweep very early, Razzak darted it down the leg side and Strauss corrected to play a  reverse-guide-to-third-man
delicate, very good from Collingwood, paddling a sweep shot very finely to collect four
good bowling from Rubel, Strauss was looking for to chip a full ball over the keeper's head, but he ended up toe-ending it back to the bowler
good stuff again from Rubel, finding some away drift at a full length, Strauss squeezed it out to extra cover
good catch on the boundary at deep midwicket by Ashraful, diving forward as Collingwood heaved a low full toss in the air, Ashraful held on and Collingwood falls
Strauss is on strike as the batsmen crossed, here he gives Morgan the strike by edging down the wicket and driving through extra cover
gets a decent delivery first up from Rubel, on and around off stump and Morgan outside edges down to third man
full ball to finish and Strauss keeps the strike by squeezing it to short third man
full and outside off from Shafiul, Strauss had wandered across his stumps looking for the leg-side dink, he misses
150 up for the England captain! What a knock, gets there by skipping outside leg stump and slicing it over point for four
given how well he's timing the ball, these shots seem needless, Strauss is again looking to deflect it behind him for four and again misses
much better from Strauss, down the wicket and crashing a drive to deep point

Morgan's gone now! Wickets falling quickly to make a very strange looking scorecard. Morgan tried to smash this over long on, but it was too full for him to get the elevation on the shot and it spooned to Tamim at mid on
Strauss is down the wicket again and driving sweetly to deep cover for a single to keep the strike
the batsman wandered miles outside leg stump and Rubel followed him, cramping Strauss for room and it thuds off the pad for one
nothing fancy from Bopara first ball, just opening the face and guiding it to third man to give the strike back to his captain

Strauss falls now, but what an innings it's been! 154 from 140 balls, he's been threatening all summer in one-day cricket, looking in sublime touch without making the big score, this time he's really done his job. In the end he sliced an attempted cover drive in the air where deep point held on
at the moment he's content to take a single to third man and give Tim Bresnan, returning to the side in place of Anderson today, the strike
awful delivery from Rubel, short and wide and Bresnan helps himself to four, crashing it through point
much better, full and straight and Bresnan crashes it back down to long on, via the bowler for a single
Bresnan gets a yorker from Shafiul, good delivery and is jabbed back to the bowler
full again, Bresnan this time manages a drive, that goes quickly to long on
Bopara gets two here, thanks to some swift running, the batsman walked across to off stump and flicked it wide of deep midwicket for a couple
just a single here, similar shot, but going straight to the fielder on the boundary
very unlucky for Shafiul here, good slower ball, deceives Bresnan as he has a heave across the line, but it took a top edge and flew over the keeper for four more
gone this time, wickets tumbling! Bresnan tried to smash it over long on but it was a slower ball and he couldn't time it, Tamim took the chance running in off the boundary
he's away straight away, driving neatly through cover for a single
Bopara still can't find a big shot, instead picks a single down the ground
300 up for England, Yardy chipping down to long on for one
this time Bopara set himself for a big shot, but it was full and swinging into the batsman and he could only swing it down to long on for a single
odd shot this, it was a slower ball heading a long way down the leg side, Yardy was through his leg-side heave very early and it came off the back of the bat down to third man
Bopara gets four this time, but not as he planned, length ball from Rubel, which is dangerous, and it flew off an outside edge wide of the keeper
Yardy wanders outside leg stump, but it's a good full ball and he can only drive gently to cover
good bowling this, Bopara was looking for a big shot over the leg side, but Razzak went full outside off and Bopara could only squeeze an outside edge away
Yardy is looking to give  himself room to go off side, but misses and it runs off his pads for one
again Bopara is aiming a big leg-side shot, but once more he can't time it and it trickles to deep midwicket
Yardy wanders across to off stump this time and fiddles it round the corner for one
bang! Finally Bopara pulls it off, getting down on one knee and sweeping it handsomely into the crowds at deep square
length ball outside off is asking for trouble, Yardy crashed it to deep point to give Bopara the strike back
oh dear, this is not the time to bowl a no ball! It was on a length as well and Bopara swung it towards deep midwicket for a couple. Free hit time
wow, that's pretty special! Bopara drove a length ball perfectly straight and over the sightscreen
oh again! Lucky for Bopara and he has four more, slicing a drive in the air over short third man for another boundary
more luck for Bopara! dropped by Rubel running in from long on, should have taken it
oh dear, punishment for the missed chance. Quality shot this, languid check-drive that flew over long on for six
Bopara finishes it in style! Six more! 28 off the final over, another length ball from Shafiul and Bopara drove it sweetly over long on for another six. What a comeback he's had!

inn2.comm: drilled first ball! Pitched up by Shahzad from round the wicket, and Tamim has hammered this straight at mid-off. This is going to be fun!
Shahzad pulls the length back, Tamim hops up and drops the ball to point
this one jags in off the seam to strike Tamim on the thigh, Bangladeshi hearts in mouths as the ball loops to slip. But no bat on that
well! No bat on this either, as Tamim swings mightily through the line. Connects with fresh air though. If he'd hit that it would have gone into orbit
first boundary for Tamim! And it wasn't a wild mow, he just eased onto the back foot and punched a drive on the up through cover. Great shot
tight single! Dropped to Bopara's right at midwicket, they set off straight away
pitched up by Bresnan, outside off and thrashed straight to the cover fielder. Tamim's hitting them, just not quite picking the gaps yet
better line from Bresnan, on off stump this time. Back of a length and Tamim gets up on his toes to defend
Tamim was thinking about the pull to this one, but just checked the shot halfway through to send the ball rolling back onto the non-striker's stumps
gentle half-volley outside off and Tamim carves through point off the front foot
tapped to mid-off, who is very deep, and they take an easy single
Imrul Kayes! What a start, on a length just outside off and Kayes just sits on the back foot and pushes his hands through the line of the ball. That raced to the point boundary
Tamim goes for the full-blooded drive, but the ball squirts off the inside edge to Bopara at midwicket
slashed over gully! Full and wide of off, Tamim swings and the ball flies to third man off the edge
hoicked across the line through midwicket. He didn't get hold of that, and just lost his balance in the shot as he tried to hit it too hard

gone! That's the wicket that England wanted, Tamim falls in pursuit of quick runs. It was a slower ball, very full and Tamim tried to smash it over long-off. But he just got underneath it, and the fielder at mid-off circled underneath the steepling chance. Big breakthrough for England, do Bangladesh have the fight in them to keep up the attack without their star batsman?
rising from a length just outside off, and this strikes the splice before rolling towards point
crunchy backfoot drive, but he picks out the cover fielder
Bresnan lands one on a length on off stump, Junaid presses half forward and defends to cover
again, line and length and Junaid defends back down the wicket this time
just nipping in off the seam slightly, Junaid defends a little awkwardly as the ball comes back in towards his midriff
Junaid is just sitting at the crease and letting Bresnan dictate terms here. Again, it's on a length and he defends to cover
bad ball from Bresnan, and Junaid can at least capitalise on this. Pushed down the leg side, Junaid glances fine and that's four
pushed to point with slightly more intent, they consider a single but Kayes wisely sends him back
Kayes is really timing these forcing shots off the back foot, but keeps on picking out the fielders, as he does here
now he loses his shape and balance as he tries to waft outside off, and the ball shoots past the outside edge
length on off stump, and tapped back to the bowler
lively short ball from Shahzad, and it leaps up into Kayes' ribcage as he tries to nudge to the leg side
tight line and length on off stump, and Kayes stays at the crease to defend

Shahzad is pumped up now! It was another fiery short ball, on the off side this time and Kayes couldn't get the glove out of the way in time as the ball rose up at him. A little touch on the ball as it went through, and Kieswetter does the rest. Two down now, and one can feel the fight going from Bangladesh now.
another short ball, Junaid didn't know much about this as he threw the bat at it but he got enough on it to send the ball sailing over Shahzad's head at fine leg.
pushed wide this time, Junaid tries to slap through cover but bottom-edges the drive and the ball goes nowhere
angled across again, and going further away off the seam. Junaid guides down to third man
Bresnan lands one on a length and straight, the ball thumps into Jahurul's pad but the appeal is quickly turned down. The ball was going over leg stump
defended quietly to cover
Bresnan pulls the length back slightly, Jahurul defends to mid-on from the crease
on the hips, Junaid gets across to off stump and clips the ball out to deep square leg

effort ball from Shahzad, as he slams the ball down short outside off. He got some good work on the ball, as it jagged viciously away off the seam to beat the outside edge by a good few inches, but this'll be a free hit
full, not quite the half-volley though and Jahurul clears the left leg to slam the ball back down the wicket. Shahzad did really well to get a hand on this, but he couldn't cut it off
decent ball for a man with a sore hamstring. Good pace, on a length and straight and Junaid defends to mid-on
sliced past backward point off the back foot, Bresnan at third man runs round to cut it off
full, and what a shot from Junaid! He's not given up yet, stepping down the track and biffing through the line to send the ball down to the straight long-on boundary
slapped leg-side again, this one goes through midwicket as Junaid swipes across the ball slightly. Good connection in the shot, though, and he's placed it perfectly to pick up four more!
Broad will bowl a heavy ball here, slamming it down back of a length as Jahurul gets up on his toes to defend
dropped towards cover, the single is quickly turned down
short, the ball rises up to helmet height but Jahurul is waiting for it and thumps a pull through wide mid-on! That was a quick bouncer, but he's hammered it well infront of square
wobbling down on a length this time, again it was pacy but Jahurul pushes forward to defend
driven on the up to cover with minimal footwork
just a little push into the gap between the cover fielders, but he's actually timed that quite well and the fielder has to hurry to keep it to one
short of length outside off, Jahurul stands up tall and guides to gully
Jahurul picks the length early and pulls handsomely up and over the midwicket fielder! Again he saw it easily and crunched the shot infront of square
intentional thick edge down to third man, not quite fine enough to find the boundary though
full on off stump, Junaid taps to cover, who is on the edge of the circle, and they pick up a quick single
Bresnan finds some extra bounce outside off to beat the edge of Jahurul's forcing stroke. He was lucky not to edge that, it was very close to the gloves/splice
tapped softly to point
spitting up from a length to strike the splice, they think about the single but the fielder at cover is in too quickly

slower ball, but it's slipped out a leg-stump half-volley... And that's actually a missed chance for a run-out, as Junaid turns blind and sets off for the second! The throw landed quite close to Kieswetter though, and shot under his gloves. Junaid wasn't even in the picture
gloved towards short fine leg. Off the thigh pad, rather, but awkwardly played nonetheless
solid-looking defensive stroke to cover
on-drive back past the bowler, but it's come off the very end of the bat and so mid-on has time to run round and cut it off
slower ball, and it's quite short on leg stump. Junaid paddle-pulls to short fine leg
after all that, Bresnan goes full towards the pads and it's swished over the infield for four to deep midwicket
shorter this time, Jahurul aims a big hook shot, but gloves it behind square and they take a single

good catch Luke Wright! Slower ball from Bresnan, Siddique flicked it hard, looking to clear mid on but Wright moved swiftly to his left and held on to the chance above his head. Another one down for Bangladesh
the batsmen crossed so Jahurul is one strike and he defends this fuller ball very quietly
slightly quicker from Bresnan here and Jahurul is forward again, defending to mid on
oh shot! Bang! Bresnan shoved it in short outside off, and Jahurul climbed into a pull shot, dragging it from outside off well in front of midwicket, raced to the boundary. Really got all of that
slower ball from Broad to the new man, Shakib turns it to midwicket
good ball this, back of a length, shaping back to the left hander at a good pace, Shakib hurries into a defence
pacey again from Broad, but with a fraction of width, Shakib rides the bounce and runs it towards third man
fuller from Broad and Jahurul very firmly drove back at him
short this time, Jahurul has looked very comfortable pulling and it goes quickly down to deep square
slower ball to finish, but good line and length and Shakib defends
Bresnan with a slower ball here and it's stroked gently to point
back of a length this time and defended off the back foot
banged in a little shorter, gets up but Jahurul rides the bounce and defends
fuller here, Jahurul gets forward and defends carefully
Jahurul is looking comfortable, but not doing anything too fancy, just defending with a very straight bat
good over from Bresnan ends with Jahurul dropping it towards midwicket and taking a single
back of a length and blocked solidly to cover
some extra bounce here for Broad, Jahurul looks a touch uneasy in defence, ripping his bottom hand of the bat as he plays the shot
slower ball and fuller, Jahurul flicks it to deep midwicket for one
Shakib hasn't had strike for a while but is very solidly behind this
dug in a bit shorter, Shakib tries to pull but it's on to him too quickly and it crashes into his body
good here, a touch slower and outside off, Shakib tries to work it down to third man but it comes off the bottom edge
another slower ball, and a good line, calmly defended
floated up outside off stump, gently driven to point
tighter line here from Bresnan, Jahurul seems to have settled into a defensive mode here and taps it to cover
well, no matter what mode your in, if you get short balls like this they need to be punished and Jahurul hasn't missed a pull shot all innings, he played this very firmly through midwicket for four
long appeal from Bresnan, it was on a good length and nipped back at Jahurul, rapped him on the pads but it was going over the top
good intent from Jahurul, skipping up the wicket towards Bresnan, but he gets there and aims a big mow that comes off the inside edge and bounces through to Kieswetter behind the stumps
Broad mixing up his pace a lot here, but maintaining his line well, Shakib defends
this is much sharper, climbing from just back of a length and Shakib has to defend in a hurry
touch too far down the leg side here from Broad, Shakib turns it round the corner off his hip for a single to fine leg
Jahurul falls! The short ball proves his undoing. Well, Jahurul has actually played the shot very well today but this time it got a bit high on his pull shot and he spooned it gently to midwicket
almost falls first ball! Gets a snorter from Broad, it pitched on a length and zipped off the wicket, climbing past a tentative outside edge
short ball this time, Ashraful is a little guy and it very comfortably cleared him
good ball first up, bustling in as always, and finding a good line outside off that Shakib defends
swing and a miss, just back of a length outside off and skimming past Shakib's attempted cut
not a great delivery this, short and wide, Shakib cut firmly but straight to deep point
pitched up and angled towards the pads, Ashraful clips it firmly through square leg for one
touch slower from Wright and Shakib pushes it down to mid on
good running from Shakib gets a single as he pushes to mid off and sets off for one immediately
full from Broad and Shakib turns it round the corner for a single
this is a real snorter, leapt off a length and was far too good for Ashraful
Ashraful responds by edging down the wicket, which is ambitious, it's banged in short by Broad and goes through to Kieswetter
touch fuller this time but Ashraful is still forced to play off the back foot in defence
slower delivery here and Ashraful is edging down the wicket again, pushes gently  to cover
much fuller this time and it's worked round the corner for one
slower ball to begin the over and Ashraful drove crisply back down the ground, Bresnan scoots round from mid on and makes a sliding stop
that will annoy Shakib, short and a touch wide, Shakib swishes but misses
better ball this time and Shakib can only defend
Shakib finds a single, that's better from him, dropping it into the leg side and scampering off for one

oh dear. Chaos here and Shakib has gone. This looks pretty grim. It was a no ball, Ashraful worked it round the corner, scampered one, looked certain to be coming back for a second as he set off, calling Shakib though, but then Ashraful changed his mind, leaving Shakib stranded midpitch as Collingwood, on all fours, had time to take the bails off
which he duly edges behind, Kieswetter, thinking it was out was in full celebration! Of course it counts for nothing
this is a good delivery, kicks up off a length and defended uneasily
nicely done from Ashraful, he got plenty of sighters last over, and this time he's skipped down the wicket and the shorter ball is wide enough for him to slash over deep point for a maximum
this should probably have been called a wide, it was short and went miles over Ashraful
much full from Broad, Ashraful flashes a drive but it comes tamely off the inside edge
nicely played here, just getting his eye in by the looks of things, down the wicket and guiding it through point for a couple
very solidly behind this one, defending confidently
once again Ashraful is very studiously behind this, defending back up the pitch
tapped gently to mid-off
slightly wider of off this time, played down to backward point
speared down the leg side by Wright, Mahmudullah gets nicely across and glances right off the face of the bat down to fine leg.
slower ball, back of a length on middle and it's nicely clipped through midwicket. Sloppy fielding allows them back for two
a bouncer from Wright balloons up and over the middle and leg stumps
Wright finds some gentle shape away from the bat from a length, Mahmudullah gets his front foot forward and across and defends to off
very full, just outside off and driven through cover
full again, a yorker, and Ashraful digs it out

gone! Bopara strikes with his third ball! That was absolutely plumb, Bopara pulled the length back slightly and got the ball to jag in off the seam to strike Ashraful right infront of middle and leg. There was no issue with height, either, as the ball had kept slightly low. Oh dear. Bangladesh sink even further
full outside off, and Mashrafe just leans forward into a drive. The ball races away through the gap for four, he barely seemed to hit that!
bouncer from Bopara! That's looped way over Mashrafe, Bopara's really lucky not to be called wide there... and infact he is now wided
fuller, and defended
short and wide outside off, slashed away over point very hard and that's another  boundary
nice and straight from Wright, and defended back down the track
pulled down slightly shorter on off stump, Mahmudullah stands up tall and defends to off
fuller, and slightly quicker than the last ball. It's also kept a little low, but Mahmudullah gets the bat down in time
bouncer from Wright, shoots over middle and off as the batsman ducks underneath it
tentative prod forward, off the outside edge and away to third man for four. It would probably have carried to second slip
angled down to backward point, where Anderson makes a clean sliding stop
coming in from a wide angle, the ball pitches and shoots away from the right-hander, who stretches forward to defend but is easily beaten
slightly wider of off this time, Mashrafe is drawn into a wafty, loose drive and is beaten once again
three in three now, Bopara pulls the length back and dishes up some width too, but Mashrafe's flailing cut can't connect
beaten again? This one came back in off the seam, Mashrafe shaped to play the ball but then pulled his bat inside the line

wrapped on the pads! Huge appeal from Bopara and the men behind the wicket, but that was very full, hitting him in line with leg and would have shot down the leg side. Really good decision from the umpire there
full again, just outside off and defended to cover
Wright errs in line slightly, sending the ball down the leg side to be called wide
on a length, just outside off and defended to short extra cover
slipping in to the pads, clipped through midwicket for an ambled single
nudged off the hip out to deep square leg
short outside off stump, and he buckles the knees as the ball approaches to get underneath it. Umpire calls one for the over
width offered outside off, and a punch-drive off the back foot out to deep cover from the batsman
dropped between the men at cover and point, and they have time to run an easy single
slower ball, nicely bowled. It was an offcutter, and he landed it just outside off stump on a length. Defended to cover
quicker yorker to follow up the slower ball, but the batsman jams the bat down just in time to keep it out
outside off stump and rising, played down towards point
short, just outside off stump and Bopara finds a hint of extra bounce as he bends his back. Mashrafe is beaten on the cut
nice-looking shot from the Bangladesh captain. Bopara floats up a half-volley on middle and leg and the ball is met with a pleasant on-drive, which has the beating of the man at mid-on

well, good shot last ball, but an airy waft to the next one leads to his downfall. Bopara pulled the length back and also found some movement away from the bat. Mashrafe, who had been beaten several times on the cut already, finally gets bat on one, and Kieswetter clings on to the thick edge
nudged through midwicket to get Razzak on strike
angled across the left-hander, who raises his bat out of the way to leave
straighter this time, and Razzak glances to fine leg to get off the mark
full on middle and off, and Mahmudullah meets the ball with the most solid of forward defences
slower ball, on middle and leg. Mahmudullah didn't quite pick as he clipped uppishly to leg, but no harm done
tapped down defensively on the leg side
surprising burst of pace from Bopara, and he's almost knocked Razzaq off his feet! A much quicker ball, catching the batsman by surprise as he tucks to leg.
Mahmudullah walks down the track to get closer to the pitch of the ball, and seeing that it is full and wide of off he raises his bat to leave well alone
back-of-a-length on off stump, Mahmudullah hops back to defend
Bopara goes for the yorker but can't quite get his length right, and the resultant lef-stump half-volley is clipped through square leg
slapped back to mid-on
slower ball from Bopara, offcutter, and he gets the ball to grip and turn away slightly and beat Razzak's prod
nippy bouncer, and Mahmudullah ducks underneath it. Asad Rauf calls one for the over
worked into the leg side, and they scramble a quick single
another bouncer from Wright. Razzak weaves out of the way. No signal from the umpires though, must've been below head height
rising into the midriff, Razzak glances to short fine leg
on a length and straight, Mahmudullah defends back down the track. Required run-rate up above 10-an-over...
slightly straighter, nudged to midwicket and they take another single
pushed down the leg side, clipping the thigh pad and dropping infront of Kieswetter
chopped down to backward point
Mahmudullah skips down the track and defends mightily back to the bowler
back-of-a-length outside off, dropped down to cover
slower ball, Mahmudullah looks for the single to third man but can't beat backward point
checked-drive out to deep cover.
it crept to the other end, very gentle indeed. Worse still it's a no ball.
free hit is slapped to mid off, Mahmudullah ran through for a single, colliding with Asad Rauf at the striker's end, the throw came in and hit the stumps directly but he was safely home
Razzak gets everything behind a forward defensive block
Trott holding a good line outside off and Razzak continues to block
huzzah! A shot! And what a shot. Similar full length outside off but his time Razzak leant back and crashed it to cow corner for four
Bangladesh on the charge now, Razzak working it behind square for a single
Mahmudullah restores order with a studious forward block
it's short straight away, Razzak was already ducking while Broad was running up, it crashed into his gloves but went safely down into the leg side
short and wide outside off stump, not a great delivery, Mahmudullah fences at it but misses by a distance
speared down the leg side, short again and Broad will have to bowl that one again
better length and line and blocked resolutely
once again it's a good length and line and Mahmudullah happy to block
this wasn't particularly short but Mahmudullah swayed out the line anyway
Broad switches to round the wicket, seeing if he can create anything, he can't, Mahmudullah casually knocks it into the leg side to take a single
Trott continuing with his right-arm gentle, Mahmudullah blocks it to midwicket
this is pretty hideous to watch, Mahmudullah is just having a net out there, blocking Trott easily enough
something to cheer for the crowd as Mahmudullah unleashes a stylish cover drive and collects a couple
down the leg side from Trott and Mahmudullah flicks it to fine leg for a single
Razzak has a dart at one which is a touch wide of off, it flies airily and reaches Anderson at point on the half-volley, he misses it and Razzak collects two
beaten off the final ball! Wobbling it around off stump past the outside edge
back of a length outside off, Mahmudullah pushes it towards cover and takes a single
draws good intent from Mahmudullah, down the track and aiming a fearful swipe at Broad. Misses and is rewarded with a few choice words from the bowler
good ball here, short and climbing past Mahmudullah
well fielded by Anderson at point, who's on as a substitute  for Shahzad who has a hamstring problem, diving to stop an off-side guide from Mahmudullah
Broad round the wicket and shoving this in short, it's pacey too and steams past a hopping Mahmudullah
well it's a maiden and the short balls are good, but Broad could think about finding a length every now and then, as it is it's short and left alone
Razzak sliced this high down to the point boundary, it bounced and looked to be bobbling over the rope until Bresnan slid in and stopped it with his foot, good er tackle?
this time it's fuller and driven solidly by Razzak back at the bowler
touch wide again from Trott and Razzak has another drive outside off, good from him
tighter line and Razzak works it to midwicket to collect one
too full and a touch leg-sided, rather than swing it handsomely over the midwicket boundary, Mahmudullah tickles it round the corner for one
outside off stump, Razzak leaves it alone
shoved in short again, well outside off here, Mahmudullah wants nothing to do with it
short once more, Mahmudullah opens the face and guides it to third man for a couple
short once more, Mahmudullah happily tucks underneath it
fuller and Mahmudullah clips it to deep midwicket for a single
poor bowling this, shoved well down the leg side from a short length and Razzak leaves alone
full and wide outside off, Razzak leaves it alone
very short and Razzak ducks happily underneath it - just 84 balls to go!
decent start from Bopara, full and straight, worked to deep midwicket for a single
Razzak thinks about a cut shot to a shortish ball outside off, but then decides that leaving is a much better option
fuller this time, Razzak drives to mid off for one
a grunt from Bopara as he delivers, tickled round to deep square for a couple
Mahmudullah again dabs it into the square leg region and takes a single
swing and a miss! First incident we've had in a while, outside off stump and goes past the flashing outside edge
perhaps this is why, dragged very short and Mahmudullah crashes it to mid off
four! A boundary! Perhaps a slip would have taken this, probably not, it was short and a top-edged cut goes to the third man boundary
Mahmudullah follows the boundary by nudging into the leg side
massive appeal from Yardy, it was full and caught Yardy on the boot, looked like it was sliding down
no slip in place. Why? This finds the outside edge and goes straight to where a slip should have been, runs away for four as well, so Bangladesh are rocketing now
Razzak much more careful here, defending solidly
ooh, Mahmudullah drives at this outside off and it flies off an inside edge down to fine leg
Razzak gets a single here, worked into space
another run, carefully knocked into the leg side
play and a miss, Razzak swishes hard outside off stump, but only at thin air
another one worked here into the leg side
50 partnership up! Nicely cut towards the point boundary for a strike-stealing single
very short from Yardy, the cut shot fails to pierce the infield and is stopped at cover
this time it's tickled round the corner where a diving stop prevents runs
fuller this time and driven back to the bowler
Mahmudullah driving again but can't time it and cover collects
four runs this time, driven crisply through point for a rare boundary
Mahmudullah keeps the strike by dropping it into the off side
punched gently to cover
fuller this time, Mahmudullah is utterly solid in defence
well, a bouncer from Bopara! Not too quick, but Mahmudullah ducks underneath it
fuller, straighter. Defended.
back-of-a-length outside off, and it's run down to third man
big slash outside off from Razzak, but can't connect
arrowed in to the pads, Mahmudullah tries to tickle to leg but can't lay bat on it
forward defence...

he's given him! Mahmudullah's vigil at the crease comes to an end as Yardy strikes him on the pad. Huge appeal, and the umpire gives him out lbw. Unluckily, it must be said, as the ball was sliding down the leg side. So that eighth wicket partnership record remains...
not yet though, as he stretches forward to defend his first ball
short and wide of off, slapped out to deep cover where some relaxed fielding allows them to amble back
there we go! Smacked down the ground, a couple of bounces down to long-on. Shafiul's not going to graft this one out
Razzak joins in! The ball was shortish on middle, and he just stepped back and flat-batted it over wide mid-on
another one goes! Razzak slashes a full, wide ball out to Bresnan at deep cover. Just one wicket needed now
Shafiul heaves to leg... and the ball flies over cover, plugging in the outfield.
slower ball, full and just outside off. Shafiul was down into the slog-sweep, he was through the shot before the ball even got to him

dropped! Leading edge off Shafiul's bat, looping up gently to cover where Morgan and Tredwell converge. Neither of them really went for it, Morgan called eventually and dived, but couldn't lay a hand to it in the end
slash outside off, play and miss
stretching forward to defend
some width outside off, but tapped to the fielder
cut away past backward point
back and across to defend back down the track
full, fast and dug out to mid-on
mind the windows Shafiul! He picks up a half-volley outside off and thwacks it way over wide long-on. Some excitement for the small crowd still in!
bouncer, Rubel has a waft at it but doesn't get close. Umpire calls one for the over
full and straight, defended back to the bowler
speared down the leg side
heaved to leg, but the ball strikes high on the splice and rolls gently to midwicket
slower ball, on the legs. Rubel tries the pick up to fine leg but can't get the connection
another bouncer, another huge swing, another miss

Bopara ends the game! Shafiul almost swings himself off his feet as Bopara sends one down full and straight. His head is in the air, his eyes, presumably, closed, and he doesn't get close to it. The stumps are disturbed and that's that.
